title: John Healey – 2010 Speech to Labour Party Conference
author: admin
summary: Below is the text of the speech made by John Healey, the then Shadow Housing and Planning Minister, to the 2010 Labour Party conference.
content:
[![johnhealey](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/johnhealey-300x273.jpg)](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/johnhealey.jpg)
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association
  *[OECD]: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[PISA]: Programme for International Student Assessment

Conference, John Healey, Shadow Housing Minister responding to the housing motion, backed first by 28 CLPs and the Labour Housing Group, now, clearly, with every speaker and the whole Conference behind it.

The motion calls on the Shadow Cabinet and Parliamentary Labour Party to campaign with other groups against the new government’s housing cuts and policy changes.

We will.
